question: From the following tools/techniques of genetic engineering, identify those which are required for cloning a bacterial gene in animal cells and choose the correct option:
I. Endonuclease, II. Ligase, III. A. tumefaciens, IV. Microinjection, V. Gene gun, VI. Lysozyme, VII. Cellulase, VIII. Electrophoresis
choices: II, III, IV, VI, VII, VIII
explanation: To clone a bacterial gene (source) into animal cells (host): Lysozyme (VI) to break bacterial wall, Endonuclease (I) to cut DNA, Ligase (II) to join, Microinjection (IV) for animal cell transfer, Electrophoresis (VIII) to check. (Note: A. tumefaciens and Gene gun are typically for plants). The key D is the best fit.
